alert.note: Alert for Ocean; Western Monmouth (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 25 at 7:20PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Ocean and southwestern Monmouth Counties through 745 PM EDT... At 719 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Cream Ridge, or 16 miles southeast of Trenton, moving north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Roosevelt, Imlaystown, Clarksburg, Six Flags Theme Park and West Freehold. This includes Interstate 195 in New Jersey between mile markers 12 and 19. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
